description: June 3 was the official kickoff of summer meals at Canton Local and 5,000 meals were handed out. Canton Local has provided summer meals for the past five years and have not come close to the amount served June 3. Distribution dates are Wednesdays- June 10, June 17, June 24, July 15, July 22 and July 29.
text:
CANTON SOUTH

Helen Trompower

330-484-5293

Wildcat Bon Fire/Meet the Team will be Aug. 21. Athletes to meet at the main
stadium gate at 6:45 p.m. with announcing (7:15-7:30 p.m.) to begin at the end
of the girls soccer game. Spirit wear will be discounted, free hot dogs and
water, and pop and popcorn will be for sale. The bonfire will begin at dusk.

June 3 was the official kickoff of summer meals at Canton Local and 5,000
meals (500 bags) were handed out. Canton South Nutrition and Wellness
recognizes the frustration of running out of food so quickly. Canton Local has
provided summer meals for the past five years and have not come close to the
amount served June 3. This week they are increasing their bags to 800 (8,000
meals). They begin serving at 11 a.m. and will serve until "sold out".
Distribution dates are Wednesdays - June 10, June 17, June 24, July 15, July
22 and July 29.

EAST CANTON

Donna Robinson

330-488-2622

[donnamae723@neo.rr.com](mailto:donnamae723@neo.rr.com)

Well, things are starting to change. We have been homebound for sometime, but
today (June 7) many of the churches in the area were open. It was nice to sit
in the pews and enjoy a day of prayer and listening to our pastor and chat
with our members. Our members sat six feet apart, and no hugging or shaking
hands. And some of the restaurants have been open. We still need to be careful
and not overdue ourselves.

I would love to tell you about meetings coming up, but we know most of those
meetings will not be meeting.

Well, in 10 years we will be talking about the summer of 2020 and what we had
to live through. I bet there will be movies about this as well. I would rather
not have this happening, then to know they will be talking about it for years.

Have a good week. Keep praying that things can get back to normal.

MAGNOLIA

Jennifer Crone

330-866-4372

[jcrone@neo.rr.com](mailto:jcrone@neo.rr.com)

Happy birthday to Dominic Prosperi, Jason Gearhart, James Riter, Cindy
Sickafoose, Natasha Edwards, Pat Downes, Gloria Gordon, Paige Herstine, Dave
Saunders, Tammy Offenberger, Lukas Sudduth, Melissa Dieffenbaugher, Nancy
Spadafora Schneider, Briana Dagenhard, Jackie Betz, Rachel Schreffler, Linda
Monday, Bill Domer, Steve Loomis. Cheryl Miller, Gary Steele, Jennifer Irwin,
Betty Myers, Grace Trushel, and Alexa Dazey.

Happy anniversary to Jack and Brenda Lidderdale, Ronnie and Adriana Reed, Dan
and Carolynn Garrott, Dan and Debbie Stokes, Allan and Suzanne Tozzi, William
and Nancy Burkhart, and Warren and Sandy Snyder.

Happy 20th anniversary to John and Lucia McLaughlin.

Please contact me with the names and dates of your family's birthdays and
anniversaries so I can add them to my 2020 calendar.

Wishes of good health and God's healing go out to Mike Schmidt, Carolyn
Nicholson, Kris Hamsher, Kay Weisen, Gene Anthony, Kathy Patterson, Bruce
Gordon, Annie Lightfoot, Nick Cappillo, Ralph and Sally Rennie, Christina
(Offenberger) Stone, Charlie Hannan, and Adriana Reed.

Sympathy is extended to the family and friends of Charlie Hannan.

Louie Anthony Trainer came fast and in a hurry last weekend at 1:36 a.m.
Thankful for a healthy baby boy for Paige (Dagenhard) and Michael Trainer.
Their son weighed 7 pounds 6 ounces and was 21 inches long. Proud Magnolia
grandparents are Paul and Trisha Dagenhard.

The Nest Cafe & Ice Cream Parlor owners Ben Geiser & Nikki DeFord have been
working hard to make it a destination for delicious food, along with following
the new health guidelines. In addition to Tommy Sancic of Olde Wood Limited
donating the flooring product, Cindy Sickafoose donated beautiful oak for
chair railing in the dining areas. Mike and Eileen Hermann stained and
varnished the floor and paid for its installation. Lisa Kemp of Rob and Lesa's
Bits and Pieces made a lovely nest-themed flower arrangement. Greg Hannan did
window cleaning and repair. Mark Wadsworth repaired the plumbing. Jim Miller
helped repair light fixtures. It's great how Magnolia comes together sharing
time and talents for the good of the community.

Sandy Valley Softball Association will be distributing uniforms and refund
checks on Sunday, June 14 from 6-8 p.m. at Shepherd of the Valley Lutheran
Church. SVSA will hold its election for president and secretary that same
evening from 6-7 p.m. followed by the regular board meeting from 7-8 p.m.

The Bank of Magnolia will hold a free community shred day on Saturday, June 27
from 9-11 a.m. Please join them to help prevent identity theft. Bring your
personal documents to the Magnolia branch and shred them for free.

Have a wonderful week Magnolia. Stay safe. Please call or email your news for
next week so you can be the Talk of the Town!

EAST SPARTA

Maria Mackey

330-232-5329

[mariadonhawker@att.net](mailto:mariadonhawker@att.net)

Happy birthday to Alexis Crouse, Karrah Swier, Doug Dillon, and Katie Stewart.

A special happy birthday goes out to my nephew Jonah Wiandt.

Get-well wishes and prayers for healing go out to Shawn Mason, Kris Hamsher,
Dan Mason, Melinda Farber, Joe Stelluto, Chip Young, Rich Burchell, Vanessa
Eichelberger, Phyllis Strad, Ron Summers, Cheryl Eibel, the McKinney family,
Nancy Tolfo, Gary Mosberger, and Tina Davies.

Prayers and sympathy go out to the family and friends of Charles Hannan.

The weekend of Father's Day, June 19-21, a food truck will be parked by the
East Sparta Community Building. Funds raised will go towards Save a Mom dog
rescue. Call Linda Muir at 330-866-3205 for details.

The first Monday of each month at noon the East Sparta Volunteer Fire
Department will be doing a tornado siren test. Do not be alarmed. It appears
our new siren is working fine.

The next Pike Township Clean-up Day will be held in October. If you need to
dispose of things before that, trustee President Doug Baum made some
suggestions at the last meeting. You can put a TV out with your regular trash
as well as latex paint. If the paint isn't dried, please fill it with kitty
litter. Tires can be taken to 742 Shroyer Ave. Call 330-489-3377 for hours.
Each resident can take up to 12 tires in per year. For paper, plastic, and
cardboard make sure you make use of the bins at the township building and the
fire station on Dueber. Any scrap metal, for example box springs, lawnmower
decks, washers and dryers, can be taken to Morris Brothers at 833 Cleveland
Ave. SW or Jeffco Metals, 1140 Marion SW. More information is available on
[timetorecycle.org](http://timetorecycle.org).

The East Sparta Garage Sales are July 10-11. A vendor event will also be held
at the Community Building. Confirmed vendors are: Paparazzi, Norwex, Pink
Zebra, Tupperware, Color Street, and Scentsy. The cost is $10 per day. There
are a few spots inside. Outside is available. For more information contact
Tammy Gotchall McKinney through the East Sparta Artisian Market-Homecoming
festival page on Facebook.

East Sparta, Pike Township, and Sandyville, please contact me with your
birthdays, anniversaries, and news. Have a great week!

WAYNESBURG

Jennifer Crone

330-866-4372

[jcrone@neo.rr.com](mailto:jcrone@neo.rr.com)

Happy birthday to Jimmy Darby, Samantha Givens, Nate Waggoner, Kyle Dierick,
Summer Corsi, Mary Ann Miller, John Broucker, Dorothy Reed, Virginia
Mastroine, Nan Welker, Alexandria Woodin, and Brynna Curly.

Happy anniversary to Ken and Stacy Walter.

Please contact me with the names and dates of your family's birthdays and
anniversaries so I can add them to my calendar.

Wishes of good health and God's healing go out to Biff Capone, Randy
Swinehart, Cheryl Calkins, Janice Leech, Esther Albery, Sophia Moneypenney,
Jim and Jane France, George Miller, Liz French, Donna Modranski, Ralph and
Sally Rennie, Nick Cappillo, Ron Suciu, Daniel Linder, Vicky Oboy, Christina
(Offenberger) Stone, Shirley Neice, and Kenny Flesher, Jr.

The Village of Waynesburg is happy to announce that the Village Park is
partially back open. Per the Stark County Health Department, you are allowed
to use the walking track basketball court, baseball field, and the sand
volleyball court. The pavilion and the playground equipment are still closed
until further instruction from Gov. DeWine. Yes, this is a slow process, but a
necessary one. Thank you for your patience as we continue to stay safe and
follow the mandatory social distancing guidelines.

To conserve space, please read the Magnolia Talk of the Town column for items
regarding Sandy Valley School news and events.

Have a wonderful week Waynesburg! Stay safe. Please call or email me your news
for next week so we can all keep Waynesburg moving forward.

title: Talk Of The Town
html:
CANTON SOUTH

Helen Trompower

330-484-5293

Wildcat Bon Fire/Meet the Team will be Aug. 21. Athletes to meet at the main stadium gate at 6:45 p.m. with announcing (7:15-7:30 p.m.) to begin at the end of the girls soccer game. Spirit wear will be discounted, free hot dogs and water, and pop and popcorn will be for sale. The bonfire will begin at dusk.

June 3 was the official kickoff of summer meals at Canton Local and 5,000 meals (500 bags) were handed out. Canton South Nutrition and Wellness recognizes the frustration of running out of food so quickly. Canton Local has provided summer meals for the past five years and have not come close to the amount served June 3. This week they are increasing their bags to 800 (8,000 meals). They begin serving at 11 a.m. and will serve until "sold out". Distribution dates are Wednesdays - June 10, June 17, June 24, July 15, July 22 and July 29.

EAST CANTON

Donna Robinson

330-488-2622

donnamae723@neo.rr.com

Well, things are starting to change. We have been homebound for sometime, but today (June 7) many of the churches in the area were open. It was nice to sit in the pews and enjoy a day of prayer and listening to our pastor and chat with our members. Our members sat six feet apart, and no hugging or shaking hands. And some of the restaurants have been open. We still need to be careful and not overdue ourselves.

I would love to tell you about meetings coming up, but we know most of those meetings will not be meeting.

Well, in 10 years we will be talking about the summer of 2020 and what we had to live through. I bet there will be movies about this as well. I would rather not have this happening, then to know they will be talking about it for years.

Have a good week. Keep praying that things can get back to normal.

MAGNOLIA

Jennifer Crone

330-866-4372

jcrone@neo.rr.com

Happy birthday to Dominic Prosperi, Jason Gearhart, James Riter, Cindy Sickafoose, Natasha Edwards, Pat Downes, Gloria Gordon, Paige Herstine, Dave Saunders, Tammy Offenberger, Lukas Sudduth, Melissa Dieffenbaugher, Nancy Spadafora Schneider, Briana Dagenhard, Jackie Betz, Rachel Schreffler, Linda Monday, Bill Domer, Steve Loomis. Cheryl Miller, Gary Steele, Jennifer Irwin, Betty Myers, Grace Trushel, and Alexa Dazey.

Happy anniversary to Jack and Brenda Lidderdale, Ronnie and Adriana Reed, Dan and Carolynn Garrott, Dan and Debbie Stokes, Allan and Suzanne Tozzi, William and Nancy Burkhart, and Warren and Sandy Snyder.

Happy 20th anniversary to John and Lucia McLaughlin.

Please contact me with the names and dates of your family's birthdays and anniversaries so I can add them to my 2020 calendar.

Wishes of good health and God's healing go out to Mike Schmidt, Carolyn Nicholson, Kris Hamsher, Kay Weisen, Gene Anthony, Kathy Patterson, Bruce Gordon, Annie Lightfoot, Nick Cappillo, Ralph and Sally Rennie, Christina (Offenberger) Stone, Charlie Hannan, and Adriana Reed.

Sympathy is extended to the family and friends of Charlie Hannan.

Louie Anthony Trainer came fast and in a hurry last weekend at 1:36 a.m. Thankful for a healthy baby boy for Paige (Dagenhard) and Michael Trainer. Their son weighed 7 pounds 6 ounces and was 21 inches long. Proud Magnolia grandparents are Paul and Trisha Dagenhard.

The Nest Cafe & Ice Cream Parlor owners Ben Geiser & Nikki DeFord have been working hard to make it a destination for delicious food, along with following the new health guidelines. In addition to Tommy Sancic of Olde Wood Limited donating the flooring product, Cindy Sickafoose donated beautiful oak for chair railing in the dining areas. Mike and Eileen Hermann stained and varnished the floor and paid for its installation. Lisa Kemp of Rob and Lesa's Bits and Pieces made a lovely nest-themed flower arrangement. Greg Hannan did window cleaning and repair. Mark Wadsworth repaired the plumbing. Jim Miller helped repair light fixtures. It's great how Magnolia comes together sharing time and talents for the good of the community.

Sandy Valley Softball Association will be distributing uniforms and refund checks on Sunday, June 14 from 6-8 p.m. at Shepherd of the Valley Lutheran Church. SVSA will hold its election for president and secretary that same evening from 6-7 p.m. followed by the regular board meeting from 7-8 p.m.

The Bank of Magnolia will hold a free community shred day on Saturday, June 27 from 9-11 a.m. Please join them to help prevent identity theft. Bring your personal documents to the Magnolia branch and shred them for free.

Have a wonderful week Magnolia. Stay safe. Please call or email your news for next week so you can be the Talk of the Town!

EAST SPARTA

Maria Mackey

330-232-5329

mariadonhawker@att.net

Happy birthday to Alexis Crouse, Karrah Swier, Doug Dillon, and Katie Stewart.

A special happy birthday goes out to my nephew Jonah Wiandt.

Get-well wishes and prayers for healing go out to Shawn Mason, Kris Hamsher, Dan Mason, Melinda Farber, Joe Stelluto, Chip Young, Rich Burchell, Vanessa Eichelberger, Phyllis Strad, Ron Summers, Cheryl Eibel, the McKinney family, Nancy Tolfo, Gary Mosberger, and Tina Davies.

Prayers and sympathy go out to the family and friends of Charles Hannan.

The weekend of Father's Day, June 19-21, a food truck will be parked by the East Sparta Community Building. Funds raised will go towards Save a Mom dog rescue. Call Linda Muir at 330-866-3205 for details.

The first Monday of each month at noon the East Sparta Volunteer Fire Department will be doing a tornado siren test. Do not be alarmed. It appears our new siren is working fine.

The next Pike Township Clean-up Day will be held in October. If you need to dispose of things before that, trustee President Doug Baum made some suggestions at the last meeting. You can put a TV out with your regular trash as well as latex paint. If the paint isn't dried, please fill it with kitty litter. Tires can be taken to 742 Shroyer Ave. Call 330-489-3377 for hours. Each resident can take up to 12 tires in per year. For paper, plastic, and cardboard make sure you make use of the bins at the township building and the fire station on Dueber. Any scrap metal, for example box springs, lawnmower decks, washers and dryers, can be taken to Morris Brothers at 833 Cleveland Ave. SW or Jeffco Metals, 1140 Marion SW. More information is available on timetorecycle.org.

The East Sparta Garage Sales are July 10-11. A vendor event will also be held at the Community Building. Confirmed vendors are: Paparazzi, Norwex, Pink Zebra, Tupperware, Color Street, and Scentsy. The cost is $10 per day. There are a few spots inside. Outside is available. For more information contact Tammy Gotchall McKinney through the East Sparta Artisian Market-Homecoming festival page on Facebook.

East Sparta, Pike Township, and Sandyville, please contact me with your birthdays, anniversaries, and news. Have a great week!

WAYNESBURG

Jennifer Crone

330-866-4372

jcrone@neo.rr.com

Happy birthday to Jimmy Darby, Samantha Givens, Nate Waggoner, Kyle Dierick, Summer Corsi, Mary Ann Miller, John Broucker, Dorothy Reed, Virginia Mastroine, Nan Welker, Alexandria Woodin, and Brynna Curly.

Happy anniversary to Ken and Stacy Walter.

Please contact me with the names and dates of your family's birthdays and anniversaries so I can add them to my calendar.

Wishes of good health and God's healing go out to Biff Capone, Randy Swinehart, Cheryl Calkins, Janice Leech, Esther Albery, Sophia Moneypenney, Jim and Jane France, George Miller, Liz French, Donna Modranski, Ralph and Sally Rennie, Nick Cappillo, Ron Suciu, Daniel Linder, Vicky Oboy, Christina (Offenberger) Stone, Shirley Neice, and Kenny Flesher, Jr.

The Village of Waynesburg is happy to announce that the Village Park is partially back open. Per the Stark County Health Department, you are allowed to use the walking track basketball court, baseball field, and the sand volleyball court. The pavilion and the playground equipment are still closed until further instruction from Gov. DeWine. Yes, this is a slow process, but a necessary one. Thank you for your patience as we continue to stay safe and follow the mandatory social distancing guidelines.

To conserve space, please read the Magnolia Talk of the Town column for items regarding Sandy Valley School news and events.

Have a wonderful week Waynesburg! Stay safe. Please call or email me your news for next week so we can all keep Waynesburg moving forward.
